User.title: User
User.description: Represents a user of the CineVerse application.

profilePictureUrl.description: URL of the user's profile picture (optional).

favoriteMovieIds.description: References to favorite Movies. (Relationship: User 1:N Movie)

favoriteSeriesIds.description: References to favorite Series. (Relationship: User 1:N Series)

licenseKey.description: The active license key for the user.

Movie.title: Movie
Movie.description: Represents a movie from the TMDB API.

id.description: Unique identifier for the movie (TMDB ID).

posterPath.description: Path to the movie poster image.

backdropPath.description: Path to the movie backdrop image.

releaseYear.description: The year the movie was released.

tmdbScore.description: The score of the movie as provided by TMDB.

genreIds.description: References to Genres. (Relationship: Movie N:N Genre)

Series.title: Series
Series.description: Represents a series from the TMDB API.

id.description: Unique identifier for the series (TMDB ID).

posterPath.description: Path to the series poster image.

backdropPath.description: Path to the series backdrop image.

releaseYear.description: The year the series was released.

tmdbScore.description: The score of the series as provided by TMDB.

genreIds.description: References to Genres. (Relationship: Series N:N Genre)

id.description: Unique identifier for the genre (TMDB ID).

name.description: Name of the genre (e.g., Action, Comedy, Drama).

WatchProgress.title: WatchProgress
WatchProgress.description: Represents a user's watch progress for a specific media item.

id.description: Unique identifier for the watch progress record (usually the media ID).

mediaId.description: The ID of the movie or series.

seasonNumber.description: The season number for a TV series.

episodeNumber.description: The episode number for a TV series.

lastWatchedAt.description: Timestamp of when the media was last watched.

media.description: Denormalized media data for quick access.

License.title: License
License.description: Represents a license key for watching content.

claimedBy.description: The UID of the user who claimed the license.

claimedAt.description: Timestamp of when the license was claimed.

firestore.reasoning:
The Firestore structure is designed to ensure security, scalability, and ease of debugging, following the principles of Authorization Independence, Clarity of Intent, and DBAC. It leverages denormalization and structural segregation to optimize security rules and query performance.

Authorization Independence is achieved by avoiding `get()` calls in security rules. User-specific data (favorites, watchProgress) are stored under the `/users/{userId}` path, which eliminates the need to fetch parent document data to authorize access.  Movies and Series collections are globally accessible for reading but restricted for modification, ensuring that only authorized services can update them.

The structure supports QAPs through structural segregation. Movies and series data are separated into distinct collections. User-specific favorite movies and series are stored within the user's document. This separation enables secure list operations, preventing unauthorized access to user data or modification of movies and series data.

The design uses hierarchical paths for user-owned data (`/users/{userId}/favoriteMovies/{movieId}`, `/users/{userId}/watchProgress/{mediaId}`) to represent the `User 1:N Media` relationship, which provides a clear ownership model. The movie and series data is globally available, for easy listing and retrieval without complex security rules.
